pr_title: DHFPROD-5663: Migrate matching, merging, and mastering steps

timeline.bodyText: Can you include the value of type in here - e.g. "Invalid step type: " + type
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: I think targetEntityType and selectedSource are supposed to stay here - did you mean to remove them? They don't need to exist in matching/merging yet.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: Per the story, let's stick with match-merge-reader/writer here instead of flow-reader/writer.
timeline.author: rjrudin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,102 @@

+'use strict';
+
+const DataHubSingleton = require('/data-hub/5/datahub-singleton.sjs');
+
+// define constants for caching expensive operations
+const dataHub = DataHubSingleton.instance();
+
+const collections = ['http://marklogic.com/data-hub/steps/mastering', 'http://marklogic.com/data-hub/steps'];
+const databases = [dataHub.config.STAGINGDATABASE, dataHub.config.FINALDATABASE];
+const permissions = [xdmp.permission(dataHub.consts.DATA_HUB_FLOW_WRITE_ROLE, 'update'), xdmp.permission(dataHub.consts.DATA_HUB_FLOW_READ_ROLE, 'read')];

timeline.bodyText: Mastering/matching/merging actually use "targetEntity" instead of targetEntityType - that's something we'll be making consistent in 5.4. But while this should be "targetEntity", I think you can safely remove this function altogether, as it's not exported below. Can also remove - getSelectedSourceProperty and getVersionProperty (getVersionProperty really needs to be removed in a separate JIRA ticket altogether, as "version" isn't being used by artifacts yet).
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText:
Removing getVersionProperty() causes this error:
RESTAPI-INVALIDCONTENT: (err:FOER0000) Invalid content: invalid mlRunIngest extension: could not parse JavaScript extension mlRunIngest; please see the server error log for detail JS-JAVASCRIPT: getVersionProperty, -- Error running JavaScript request: ReferenceError: getVersionProperty is not defined; mlRunIngest either is not a valid JavaScript module or does not export functions (transform)
replies.author: fsnow

timeline.bodyText: I don't think any validation is required here - it's best just to return the artifact.
timeline.author: rjrudin
rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: @ryanjdew There's currently validation in here, and I agree with dropping targetEntityType and selectedSource. But I'm thinking we shouldn't do any validation at all, as I don't think there's a requirement that matching steps currently have a "name". I think we can tackle validation in 5.4.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: Same as above - use match-merge-reader/writer and drop validation, along with getEntityNameProperty and getSelectedSourceProperty and getVersionProperty.
timeline.author: rjrudin

+
+const collections = ['http://marklogic.com/data-hub/steps/merging', 'http://marklogic.com/data-hub/steps'];
+const databases = [dataHub.config.STAGINGDATABASE, dataHub.config.FINALDATABASE];
+const permissions = [xdmp.permission(dataHub.consts.DATA_HUB_FLOW_WRITE_ROLE, 'update'), xdmp.permission(dataHub.consts.DATA_HUB_FLOW_READ_ROLE, 'read')];

timeline.bodyText: I think this should have "@test" on it?
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: I had intended to remove that. I will replace it with a mastering flow test that uses the small Customer dataset.
replies.author: fsnow

timeline.bodyText: There are unfortunately a lot of equality assertions in the DHF codebase that use assertTrue instead of assertEquals - this should be "assertEquals(6, getFinalDocCount(...), "message").
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: installProjectInFolder will do this automatically for you, but the folder has to be named "data" instead of "input"
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: I believe you can delete this whole try/catch block then, correct?
replies.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: Yes, I had intended to do that. Just pushed an update with it removed.
replies.author: fsnow

timeline.bodyText: I think you should be able to run the mastering test on the same data that you used for the matching and merging test, which I highly recommend because we know there's exactly one match expected. We don't want to repeat the assertions from MasterTest, where we expect a very high count of documents, and when that count isn't met, it's nearly impossible to determine why not.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: This same method exists in MasterTest. I think it can be moved to AbstractHubCoreTest and called in both the tests.
timeline.author: srinathgit

replies.bodyText: I removed this test adapted from MasterTest and all of its helper methods.
replies.author: fsnow

timeline.bodyText: There seems to be a lot of overlap (and duplication) between this test and FlowMigratorTest. I think it would be better to have one test  class in which a project can be migrated, the artifacts verified and then run.
timeline.author: srinathgit

replies.bodyText: I don't mind a separate test class, as long as we have separate scenarios (in fact, complex scenarios often warrant their own test class with a single test method). I agree that duplication of assertions on ingestions and mapping steps can be removed. But I don't mind a separate class.
replies.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be good to have similar methods for mastering, matching and merging steps and make sure that the files are created and looks as expected.
timeline.author: srinathgit

timeline.bodyText: Can remove this and "requiredProperties" above too; can remove this function from matching and merging too
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: Done. I had forgotten to remove the function from the exports so I was getting an error in bootstrap.
replies.author: fsnow

timeline.bodyText: To Srinath's point above - if we're not introducing any new assertions in the AllSteps class, you could remove the ingestion and mapping steps to simplify the test class.
timeline.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: How would I get the data into the FINAL database (for matching and merging) without ingestion and mapping steps?
replies.author: fsnow

replies.bodyText:
In the future, you can just use HubClient to insert documents - see the ReferenceModelProject class for examples of that.
But leaving these steps here for that purpose is fine, no need to redo.
replies.author: rjrudin

timeline.message: DHFPROD-5663: Migrate matching, merging, and mastering steps
